text: we've come to the end of their tether
really our patience has now run out with
Sir John we went to meet with Sir John
when he first opened up the inquiry and
he promised us it would be full and
robust and delivered on time more or
less and we weren't expecting one or two
years but now it's six years overdue and
it has gone on too far we understand so
John has even refused help offered him
by by David Cameron and it's it's got to
stage now where Iraq is like an open
wound and it's continually prodded and
open with all these delays the families
want closure now we need to know why I
loved ones died those that were
seriously wounded and maimed their
families will want to know why their
loved ones have ended up in that state
and for me Sir John's got the balance
wrong now it's this maximization process
as it's called which gives those that
are criticised in the inquiry the
opportunity to respond to that criticism
well that maximization process has now
been running for two years some haven't
even bothered to respond to the
criticism and we feel Sir John needs to
give a deadline to these people now that
have been criticized either responding
to six months perhaps or we go to
publish it anyway without your response
there's no legal reason why he should
actually give a maximal OHS maximization
process to this inquiry and for me it
should delay after delay after delay and
I sometimes feel that Sir John doesn't
understand the power of feeling of these
families this isn't an inquiry into the
price of milk or the price of rail
travel or the price of I don't know
energy it's an inquiry why a country
went to war that is the need to be
answers to this why the house was misled
by Tony Blair we have to remember which
surprised me as well when I went to two
sittings at the Iraq inquiry when Tony
Blair gave evidence there were actually
Iraqi families there which I hadn't
thought about to be honest but when you
figure that over a hundred thousand
innocent Iraqi men women and children
were also killed in this conflict there
in rocky families that there who require
answers as well so we think Sir John's
had long enough we want to give him a
deadline to the end of the year to
publish the report or legal action will
follow read
what form might legal action take and
what power might it have well my
understanding from a quick briefing from
the solicitors that are involved with
this is that they will give Sir John a
deadline we think it's reasonable for
the end of the year and if that's not
forthcoming we will seek a judicial
review into the conduct of Sir John and
then take it from there
within this inquiry you're getting lots
of like mini trials going on which could
drag it out indefinitely so John needs
to say enough is enough three months to
respond or on publishing and let's get
on with it and so John if you're not up
to it give it to somebody that is
because my understanding is David
Cameron's offered your help and you
refused and I'm losing patience Sir John
you've let us down get on with it
